text: For some reason this always seemed to be THE most (and probably only) overlooked piece in the original Katamari's soundtrack. Which is a shame, because it's smooth as hell and, as a few others have said, refreshing.

text: My second favourite track after Lonely Rolling Star. Never even played the game, i just know the soundtrack really well and love it :)

text: If you haven't already, play Star Fox 64. The game has an excellent and underrated soundtrack.

text:
Sometimes I go on youtube and oh, an unknown track uploaded by Supradarky... Couldn't have found a better music for this hot summer evening in France. Thanks for all, and please more jazz !!

author: RoyalGreenTea

text: One of the more serious Katamari songs, but just as solid and enjoyable. There haven't been too many jazzy tracks on this list eventhough I love the genre, so this feels refreshing. It's the Jazz Festival here in Montreal right now, it's fitting! I haven't started working on the #1600 video yet, I know the series that will be represented but I'm still not sure which track I'll go with. I'll try to finish it all up in a timely manner.

text: I'd say the jazziest song in the game is Que Sera Sera. This is a great song, but I never would have interpreted it as jazz.

text: It is very refreshing. The mix of silly, upbeat songs and the more "serious" ones like this are what makes the Katamari series' music so memorable.
